title.narrative: Info-com programme: The World Needs to Put Gender Equality First 2018–2022.

description.narrative: Info-com programme: The World Needs to Put Gender Equality First 2018 – 2022. The programme comprises two sub-programs: 1 #awomensrights 2 #challengepoverty (pedagogical material for upper secondary schools and for We Effect member organisations). During the programme period 2018-2022, We Effect will work towards three of the United Nations Global Sustainable Development goals: 1, 2 and 5. Women's rights in the countries where we work are related to the objectives of goal 1 and 2. Increased gender equality (goal 5) for women in poor countries is a prerequisite for achieving goals 1 (No poverty) and 2 (Zero hunger). The overall goal of the communication programme is to increase the knowledge of the target groups about what the SDG goal 5 contains and how the goals 1, 2 and 5 are linked together. This knowledge will increase the target groups' commitment to promoting women's rights."

Publication of debate article in Dagens Nyheter targeting the new government. Participation in mobile event by opinion makers, politicians and the public at the political fair of Almedalen in July. Continued dissemination of education materials for improved knowledge on aid work to upper secondary school students. The recruitment of the campaign The World's Toughest Job started. Major reach in Social Media when spreading films in connection with Women’s day on 8 March 2018. Publication of case stories about rural women’s situation. Recruitment campaign for the 4th edition of the Worlds Toughest Job. Sifo Opinion poll about Agenda 2030 awareness. Digital marketing of women’s rights and poverty related topics. Dissemination of educational material to upper secondary school students.
